website_summaries.verdict: A spacious, one-door family tent that will sleep up to nine and weighs under 21 pounds.
pros: This tent is easy to set up and take down and roomy enough for your whole family to sleep and store their equipment in the extra space
There’s even a detachable divider for separating it in half
cons: It is easy to set up but definitely requires more than one person

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for ancost effective and relatively rain proof tent, this is your ticket. Are there some niggling issues? Sure. For this price, it kills anything on the market. Pro tip, the guy lines are there for a reason. Use them. Make sure it's all taut. This photo was taken after two days of rain. Does an Ozark do that? Nope. Plus, the tech support has been incredibly satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Crawdad123Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: rain proof, good ventilation
customer_reviews.text: Used for 4 days, 3 nights in Iowa (late September). Held up great in heavy rain. No leaks. Was not wind tested (see update below). Was a comfortable fit for 2 adults and one child, with plenty of room to spare for gear. Large screen doors were excellent for ventilation. Love the screen doors. Easy set up and take down. Can be done by one person, but two people is ideal. Update: Used in Illinois the following September into October. Very little rain, but some strong winds. Held up great.
customer_reviews.author: NickStar

customer_reviews.title: Great for good weather only.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to LOVE this tent. For wonderfully pleasant weather, I’d highly recommend it. We slept in this for 3 nights. We were hit with a thunderstorm - not even strong enough to blow cushions off an outdoor sofa and not as bad as some we’ve weathered in other tents - and this is what we came home to. The poles snapped, the tent was collapsed and the fly was punctured. I’m SO thankful we weren’t in the tent when this happened. On the plus side, the inside was bone dry.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Warner

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Glamping
customer_reviews.text: Kept us dry through a hail storm on our first trip! Simple design, easy to put up. Seems well made. Zippers operate smoothly. Like all brands, person ratings are how many mummy bags you could cram in like sardines. This is luxurious for a family of four. A tent this large with a full fly takes up a lot of space in the car. Seems like double the bulk of our old 6-person with half fly. But worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Krumwiede

customer_reviews.title: Safest, Roomiest, and Confortable!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Like I promised here is my honest review for our amazing NTK Colorado Tends, we was two weeks attending the International Pathfinder Camporee at Oshkosh WI; we had big rain and wind 3 times but our tends was dry and safe, the kids was happy and confortable and have plenty room, still we planing to purchase the biggest NTK Super Arizona GT. Thank you NTK for a great products!!!
customer_reviews.author: Roberto G.

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Only used twice so far, but initial quality is great. Set up is exactly as expected on a 2 pole dome. The poles are sturdy. Roomy enough for a queen, a cot and space in between. I am 6’1” and I can stand reasonably. Bag it comes in is big enough to actually get it back in if you know how to roll a tent. I currently own 3 tents. Have owned numerous more. This one is my favorite so far. The most expensive I have purchased so far, but absolutely what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased overall with this tent. It set up easy and was also very easy to break back down and get rolled back up where it fit in the carrying bag. The tent seemed very well put together. We got a little rain during night 2 of our camping excursion and we remained nice and dry while sleeping in the tent. I bought this tent for overlanding there were only 2 of us sleeping in the tent we had plenty of room for our cots and belonging to fit inside with plenty of room to spare. We could easily sleep 3-4 people on cots if we arranged thing right.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Nice big tent
customer_reviews.text: Kept me bone dry this summer while camping in the Beartooth where it rained every day and night for a week
customer_reviews.author: Tom V. Stimson

customer_reviews.title: completely rain proof
customer_reviews.text: We've only used this tent 2 times so far: once in warm weather w/o the rain fly, once in a ground-shaking thunder storm. I couldn't be happier with this tent! It's well engineered, well executed, sturdy and versatile. It's got plenty of space for our family of 6 to sleep comfortably. My only complaint would be that the stakes are pretty flimsy. We live in a mountainous area of South America, so I purchased 4 heavy duty stakes separately.
customer_reviews.author: Dan F.

customer_reviews.title: Warm and draft free from the winds.
customer_reviews.text: Big Bend trip tested this first use. Winds and woke up around 30 degrees. Pulled the fly tarp down to the ground and we were warm as can be. No drafts came in at all. Probably won't use it in colder weather than this so very happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Held up on 3 day camping trip in the RAIN!
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend! No leaks or drips in the rain!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those who want to stay dry & warm ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for those who want to stay dry & warm but don't want to spend twice the money. Tested in 30 mph winds & rain in Alaska poles bend but don't break. Recommend buying longer stake poles. Would have loved to continue to use this tent unfortunately a fox or bear damaged the fly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy tent
customer_reviews.text: My son lived in this tent for 90 days. We moved it 3 times. No leaks. Great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Bovan

customer_reviews.title: Great winter tent, love the design for holding heat.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased around Aug.2017 for hunting and still using it, I like how it keeps really warm in mid 20’s+ With a small buddy heater. I have the next bigger tent if I remember correctly it sleeps 10/12 adults and mine will sleep 3 adult men on cots with plenty of room to move around and store clothing bags, bow cases. made good as a Kelty tent, stays dry,
customer_reviews.author: Big Buck

customer_reviews.title: Can take a wind storm beating and keeps the rain out!
customer_reviews.text: The tent was tested the first time we took it out! A major wind storm took place (near Staunton, Va in mid October) and the tent took it like a champ. One side would cave in and then pop out, repeat for at least 4 hours. Also easy to put up, I can pretty much put it up by myself which was a real test in case I ever take my girls camping and my husband can’t go.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Quick

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, but the elastic string for the rainfall arrived broken.
customer_reviews.text: Just got the tent and took it out with my sons camping. The elastic spring in the pole for the rain fly arrived broken. Had to duck in and out of the tent, which was a hassle. I wiil be contacting someone to ship me a new pole.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rain protection
customer_reviews.text: Love thick heavy rain guard. 10x12' floor space perfect for queen and 2 twin airmattresses plus room to walk around. Love floor material goes up walls 10"
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Camped in the Colorado mountains for 10 days with this tent. It rained every day and we stayed completely dry! It is a great tent. Enough room for 4 people and our things.
customer_reviews.author: Kanga

customer_reviews.title: Great in the Cold
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. I purchased this primarily due to the full rain fly and the cold weather Camping we have done with scouts. We were comfortable camping at 32F & 25F on consecutive nights in early April. Also performed well during light rain storm at the end of May. Easy to set up and take down with one adult (a willing Cub Scout makes it easier). Anxious to see how it performs during hot weather camping with a chance of rain as there are no windows on the rain fly.
customer_reviews.author: Scout Mom

customer_reviews.title: Durability Issues
customer_reviews.text: First off, this is a very nice tent when it comes to setup and protection from rain. However, we've only used it 3x since buying and there are holes in the bottom tarp. Unfortunate durability issues for an otherwise superb tent. Haven't been able to reach customer service, but would love to get a replacement for this other wise great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Fit six plus our gear while we all slept on inflatable mattresses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Tent was very easy to set up- just two poles for the tent structure and one for the rain fly. Material quality seems good. We used the tent for two adults, two kids and a dog and had plenty of room. Fit our queen air mattress, full size air mattress, dog bed, and bags with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for cub scouts. Used twice, once in rain. A gentle rain and everything stayed dry. Only rain got in when we exited the tent. Easy to put up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding tent
customer_reviews.text: Our family used this tent when we went down to Mariana, Florida to help those in need after hurrican Michael. The tent is completely waterproof and has a rain fly that goes all the way down to the ground. It kept all dew and wetness out of the tent...and it comes with an oversize bag to put the tent and equiptment into when eady to pack it up... it was Awesome. Love this tent. :D
customer_reviews.author: Jason Klod

customer_reviews.title: This is not the tent you are looking for.
customer_reviews.text: The tent poles are way undersized for a tent this size. Just installing the guy lines and fly stays causes the poles to buckle and deform. The tent tends to collapse towards the center causing the usable floor space to be reduced drastically if you are using cots.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Upton

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TENT!!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably as good of a tent as you will ever find for the $150 to $175 price range. My family and I love this tent!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Thomason

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Really big, but easy to assemble dome tent. Assembled it on the lawn as soon as it arrived. Unlike most tents, it fit easily back into the bag when taken down.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S Cole

customer_reviews.title: Is the rain fly sewn incorrectly???
customer_reviews.text: Red “ridge” pole on rain fly seems faulty or am I doing it wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Jessica McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it and uses it to camp out for when he’s out of town for work. Does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Young

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tent. We bought this as we've had the NTK Cherokee, and this is basically same tent, but with a upgraded rain fly.....took it island camping the last two weeks in a nearby national park. 1st weekend it was raining and storming pretty bad, very windy, this thing stayed dry and the extended rainfly worked great.....by the way, the NTK Cherokee tent is still working great, this is our 4th season on it....NTK is the best bang for the buck you're going to find anywhere!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent
customer_reviews.text: Dimensions on box are wrong! (Says 9.8’ x 9.8’) Amazon dimensions are correct: 12’ x 10’
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't stand up to wind
customer_reviews.text: Hit some heavy winds on this tents 2nd camping trip out and poll snapped on me
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Hartley

customer_reviews.title: No ventilation and smaller than described
customer_reviews.text: The tent comes with minimal instructions. We owned a smaller tent so we know the basic set up. There were no instructions to the outer layer. Once you put the outer layer, you lose all ventilation. I think this tent probably is best used in colder weather because there is no way you can sleep in temp above 72 in less you kept your the two front and back ‘doors’ open. In addition, there is no way this sleep 8 to 9 person comfortably. It was roomy for 2 adults and 2 kids (2 queen size bed). Once our bags were in, there was no room for additional sleep bag.
customer_reviews.author: WorkingMomOf2

customer_reviews.title: This tent is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: We took it camping at Mt. Mitchell, NC and it withstood torrential downpours, 40-50 mph winds! We can't say enough good things about this tent! Not one drop of water leaked from all of that rain and the side of the tent would bend in from the wind and bounce back up with no breakage ! Note: when you know you are in a windy area, we used heavy duty long stakes to keep it secured, but we use these no matter where we go. Nites were quite cold up in the mountains and it kept us warm and toasty. Love the vestibules on both ends as it gives you more areas for backpacks and boots.
customer_reviews.author: Diane in WS,NC

product_meta.title: NTK Colorado GT 8 to 9 Person 10 by 12 Foot Outdoor Dome Family Camping Tent 100% Waterproof 2500mm, Easy Assembly, Durable Fabric Full Coverage Rainfly - Micro Mosquito Mesh
feature_bullets:  DESIGNED FOR QUICK & EASY ASSEMBLY – The Colorado 8- 9 person tent is great for all the family. With easy assembly, the spacious one door tent weighs 20.7bs with a comfortable floor size of 10ft x 12ft and 6.07ft center height for maximum comfort.

 DOUBLE LAYER FULL COVERAGE RAINFLY – 100% waterproof 190T polyester laminated with polyurethane. 2500mm water column rainfly provides full coverage on all 4 sides, while the heat-seamed thermoplastic coating offers UV protection. Inner tent has a large 2-way zipper D-style door with full mosquito mesh protection. Roomy utility pocket for storage and ventilated mesh roof. Extra gear storage area is provided with the extended area on the front and back

 THICK NANO-FLEX TECHNOLOGY FRAME – Extra thick Nano-flex fiberglass poles interconnect with double gold chrome plated ferrule hardware and strong elastic, offering a sturdy construction. Made with 100% virgin material to provide additional strength and flexibility. The high-performance NTK outdoor camping tent also has a pin-and-ring system for fast and easy setup.

 HEAVY DUTY ANTI FUNGUS FLOOR MATERIAL – Seamless, anti-fungal polyethylene with a silver-coated inner layer to prevents leaks, keeping you dry and protected. The flooring has a unique bathtub-style construction barrier, designed to ensure so you won’t wake up in a puddle! CPAI-84 fire retardant rainfly comes with a zipped stuff bag and ID label to personalize your tent.

 BREATHABLE MICRO MOSQUITO MESH – Ultra-thin NO-SEE-UM polyester micro-mesh fabric keeps you safe from the smallest insects and mosquitoes – letting fresh air in while keeping bugs out! Freestanding design is easy to set up and take down. Built for the Brazilian Amazon, the Colorado 3-season dome family tent will keep you comfortable and protected from heat, rain and wind

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
